definition: lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities
pinyin: chai2 mi3 you2 yan2 jiang4 cu4 cha2

definition: firewood/lean (of meat)/thin (of a person)
surname Chai
rice/CL:粒[li4]/meter (classifier)
surname Mi
oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
salt/CL:粒[li4]
thick paste of fermented soybean/marinated in soy paste/paste/jam
vinegar/jealousy (in love rivalry)
tea/tea plant/CL:杯[bei1],壺|壶[hu2]
lit. firewood, rice, oil and salt/fig. life's daily necessities
to return to one's true self/to regain the natural state
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
dull/insipid
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
depressed/cheerless
priceless treasure
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
to worry/to be on one's mind
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
cheerful/happy
